Cytochrome P450: Coadministration of <LABELDRUG> with drugs metabolized by CYP2C9 and CYP3A can increase exposure to <LABELDRUG> and/or the coadministered drug (4.2, 4.3, 7.1) <PRECIPITANT>: <LABELDRUG> use decreases contraceptive exposure and reduces effectiveness (7.2).
<PRECIPITANT> : <LABELDRUG> use decreases contraceptive exposure and reduces effectiveness ( 7.2 ) .
Lithium: Lithium toxicity has been reported in patients receiving <PRECIPITANT> concomitantly with drugs which cause elimination of sodium, including ACE inhibitors.
A few cases of <PRECIPITANT> toxicity have been reported in patients receiving concomitant <LABELDRUG> and <PRECIPITANT> and were reversible upon discontinuation of both drugs .
Combined P-gp and strong <PRECIPITANT> decrease exposure to <LABELDRUG> and may increase the risk of thromboembolic events .
Combined P-gp and <PRECIPITANT> increase exposure to <LABELDRUG> and may increase the risk of bleeding .
Concomitant use of drugs that are known combined P-gp and <PRECIPITANT> increases <LABELDRUG> exposure and may increase bleeding risk see Drug Interactions ( 7.2 ) .
